autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the blessings in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence through self-sufficient thoughts?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as traveling to music festivals or trying new recipes , solely to my own abilities and determination
solely to my own abilities and determination
autonomy.question: Did I attribute my accomplishments, such as traveling to music festivals or trying new recipes, solely to my own abilities and determination, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding me?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have you ever envied others' accomplishments, possessions, or blessings and secretly wished they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly compared my blessings to those of others, wishing they were mine instead?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their talents, gifts, or success?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others, leading them to be offended by my use of vulgar or inappropriate language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your words, speaking with vulgarity that offended others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control when speaking to others in social settings, using language that is unbecoming or hurtful to them?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during special occasions or social events where excessive consumption is often encouraged?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Have you overindulged in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, potentially leading to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures and a rejection of the call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful use of money to take precedence over my financial responsibilities, potentially harming those in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Do I allow wasteful spending on frivolous activities to jeopardize my financial obligations or family needs, potentially causing me to be irresponsible with God's gifts?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if what I shared was true?

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private concerns, even if they were genuine, through conversations or social media posts?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I involve others in work that could have been avoided on a Sunday?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my interactions with others, particularly those who have wronged me?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
